PersonalInfos.Name: Ankit Kumar
PersonalInfos.Heading: Backend Developer | .NET | Python | SQL | REST APIs

Summary: Backend Engineer with 3+ years of experience building and modernizing large-scale flight booking systems using .NET and Python. Strong expertise in designing asynchronous REST APIs, working across integrations for multiple third-party airline providers, and migrating legacy WCF platforms to modern .NET 8 services. Experienced in SQL Server and MongoDB, internal tooling, scheduler services, and Linux-based deployments. Proven ability to work on high-traffic, business-critical systems with a focus on performance, scalability, and reliability.

Certifications.Title: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java
Data Structures and Algorithms Using Python

WorkExperience.Overview: Backend developer responsible for building, integrating, modernizing, and scaling flight booking systems. Experience spans legacy WCF services, modern async REST APIs, internal tools, scheduler services, and platform migration initiatives.
Responsibilities: Developed and maintained scalable, production-grade backend systems for flight operations using .NET and Python.
Integrated and supported 60+ third-party airline APIs to enable live search, reprice, booking, ticketing, and post-booking workflows.
Built and maintained RESTful APIs and Web Services supporting high-traffic flight booking operations.
Designed and developed internal tools and services to automate repetitive operational and testing workflows.
Optimized SQL Server and MongoDB queries, caching logic, and execution paths to improve performance and reduce system load.
Identified, debugged, and resolved production issues across booking, pricing, and API integration layers.
Designed and implemented background scheduler services for automated monitoring, reporting, fraud alerts, and data synchronization.
Collaborated closely with product, QA, and engineering leadership to deliver stable and scalable backend solutions.
Architected and developed a next-generation end-to-end flight booking backend platform with full lifecycle coverage.
Implemented a fully asynchronous architecture using async/await across APIs, services, database access, and external integrations.
Introduced a config-driven architecture enabling the same codebase to run as monolithic or microservices-based deployments.
Led large-scale migration of legacy WCF (.NET Framework 4.7.2) services to modern RESTful APIs on .NET 8.
Migrated a very large codebase involving 60+ airline providers and numerous internal systems while preserving existing schemas and contracts.
Executed incremental migration (Search → Reprice → Booking → other flows), allowing old and new systems to run in parallel in production.
Resolved breaking changes during framework migration including async behavior, threading model, dependencies, and hosting.
Reduced CPU utilization by refactoring blocking code paths into non-blocking asynchronous execution flows.
Added Linux support to previously Windows-only services and enabled cross-platform hosting using Kestrel.
Worked as part of a core team responsible for backend architecture and modernization.

Projects.Description: Developed and maintained core flight booking services integrating with multiple third-party airline providers including GDS, LCCs, and NDCs. Worked on search, reprice, booking, SSR, rescheduling, and ticketing flows.
Projects.Role: Backend developer responsible for API logic, integrations, debugging, and performance tuning.
Projects.Outcome: Improved booking reliability and reduced API latency through async processing and query optimization.

Projects.Description: Built an internal web-based tool for testing and monitoring flight APIs across multiple workflows, users, agents, partners, and countries. Later migrated the backend from Flask to FastAPI to support async APIs.
Projects.Outcome: Reduced QA testing time by over 90% and enabled async-compatible testing for new backend services.

Projects.Description: Developed background scheduler services to automate booking updates, currency synchronization, fraud alerts, API health monitoring, and daily reporting.
Projects.Outcome: Eliminated manual operational tasks and saved several hours of daily effort across teams.

Projects.Description: Created multiple internal console applications to improve developer productivity and automate routine tasks such as JSON payload generation, daily task tracking, automated Git commits, and operational utilities.
Projects.Outcome: Streamlined daily developer workflows and reduced repetitive manual work.

Projects.Description: Designed and implemented a modern, fully asynchronous flight booking backend with config-driven support for monolithic and microservices-based deployments.
Projects.Outcome: Reduced CPU usage, improved scalability, enabled cross-platform deployments, and laid the foundation for future distributed systems.

Projects.Description: Migrated a large legacy WCF-based flight booking platform to modern REST APIs on .NET 8 with incremental rollout and parallel production support.
Projects.Role: Core contributor responsible for migration implementation and stability.
Projects.Outcome: Modernized a critical legacy system supporting 60+ providers with zero business disruption.

PersonalProjects.Description: Designed a full-screen digital clock app for tablets and mobile devices. Used for visibility during study sessions, desk timers, and digital wall clocks. Supports 12/24-hour format with custom fonts and themes.
Highlights: Included always-on display mode for night use
Published during college as a practical utility

PersonalProjects.Description: Built an interactive math tables app to help kids learn and practice multiplication tables. Includes audio-based teaching, flashcard mode, and a quiz/test module with scoring.
Highlights: Gamified test mode with score tracking

PersonalProjects.Description: Created an app to help users practice fast mental math: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Used for improving speed and accuracy, with difficulty scaling and timed test challenges.
Highlights: Designed adaptive test modes (easy to expert)

Items: GATE – Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (Appeared Twice)
Strong academic performance in ML-related subjects
